text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today 
I've got another grandma recipe for you this is

the dish that grant my grandmother always makes 
every time I go home although she doesn't usually

make it vegetarian but today I am going to make it 
vegetarian this is a dish called Pad mee tiew or

Pad mee sua Pad means stir-fry and mee tiew or mee sua is 
a type of Chinese noodles that are actually really

popular during the vegan festival in Thailand this 
is also a great dish to bring to like a barbecue

or a potluck because it's that you know it's that 
noodle dish everybody loves and it goes well with

everything other people are bringing and it's 
really easy to put together let's get started

so the cooking process goes very quickly so let 
me just go over the ingredients first k so the

most important thing is the actual noodles now 
unfortunately I can't find the actual meat meat

Theo or me so I here in Vancouver but I found 
something pretty close and that is this so for

this you just want to find any kind of noodles 
that has this kind of shape and size and it's

made from wheat okay if you've got something 
like that chances are it will be okay and then

all I've done here is I just boiled them for 
two minutes so however long this will differ

depending on your type of noodles but cook it 
just so that it's under a little bit cuz we'll

cook it more in the wok drain it rinse it under 
cold water and there you have it for protein I'm

using pressed tofu pressed tofu is perfect for 
stir fries because they're so firm that it won't

fall apart this is the kind of tofu that we use 
in Pad Thai as well but for this I'm using the

marinated version which should be available at 
your Chinese grocery store my package comes like

this but there are many different brands and I 
haven't found a bad one so you can't really go

wrong okay so that's protein vegetables cabbage 
is definitely so important it gives a crunch and

also a subtle sweetness that cabbage has and I've 
just torn it into big pieces now in addition to

that I'm also gonna add some carrots which I've 
shredded using a Thai julienne peeler and if you

haven't had a chance to used hi julienne peeler 
yet it's so useful makes beautiful shreds for

salads and stir fries and then finally for some 
mommy and some texture I am using dried shiitake

mushrooms okay which I soaked in hot water and 
then I squeeze out all the water once it's soft

and then I just slice it make sure you remove the 
stem first so I put these three together because

they're all going in at the same time the one 
thing that's not going together is garlic chives

this is so popular thrown into noodles in Thailand 
it's what we throw into pop Thai and they're just

mild garlicky vegetable right here it's beautiful 
it's delicious if you haven't had it make sure

you give it a go and in terms of sauce very 
simple we're using the two soy sauces in this

the classic Thai pantry the mushroom soy sauce 
and also the golden mountain sauce you can use

regular @hi soy sauce as well doesn't have to be 
the mushroom one and that is it let's get cooking

alright so I'm just gonna go in with a little bit 
of oil and of course some chopped garlic I'm also

going to add the tofu give them time to fry a 
little bit but the wonderful thing with these

is they're so firm that you can toss them around 
all you want and they're gonna be fine they're

not gonna break apart if you using any other kind 
of tofu like regular firm tofu you'll need to fry

them first to firm up the outside and then you 
can toss them in the wok yeah some of the tofu

is getting a little Brown around the edges that 
is exactly what we want beautiful so the garlic

size is golden now I'm gonna go in with all of 
my veg the bows give them a toss and then I want

to add to some of my soy sauce just a splash 
to the vegetables to give them a little bit of

seasoning love otherwise once you add the noodles 
all the soy sauce is gonna go into the noodles so

we gotta spread the love so just a minute or so 
until the vegetables a little bit of wilted you

can smell the shitake mushrooms coming through 
and then the noodles mm-hmm and now here's my

technique the noodles are gonna be a little sticky 
so I'm gonna put my liquid seasoning right over

top and that liquid will help loosen the noodle 
move those up a little bit give that a quick toss

while the noodles are still wet perfect see now 
they kind of release a little fizzy more easily

some sugar to balance out the saltiness and also 
some white pepper I'm not making this spicy but

a little heat a little pepperiness is always nice 
now you're just gonna toss until the noodles have

absorbed all the seasonings I usually find it 
by the time I'm done my noodles are perfectly

cooked if you find that you've undercooked 
them a little and they're still not fully

cooked here you can add a little splash of water 
let it steam a little bit and that is it you are

done how easy is that and I'm gonna turn this 
off make sure I didn't forget to add anything

nope all of my things are gone sometimes that 
happens and then i'ma throw in my garlic chives

at the end just using the residual heat to wilt 
the garlic chives because you don't want to cook

them to death wonderful yeah you can beat a whole 
family of four with this recipe look at that now

there's really nothing you need to do to garnish 
this if you want like my mom always adds a little

bit of roasted chili flakes to make it spicy but 
like it is colorful and beautiful just as it is

and I know this is a serving plate but I'm just 
gonna eat it right from here because there's no

one else here except Adam and he doesn't care so 
make sure you get okay I always make sure I get

some cabbage because I love that crunch mmm 
that smell of dried shiitake mushrooms bring

me memories of my grandmother and every time 
because it's one of her favorite ingredients

it's such simple goodness I mean unlike many of 
my other recipes were like spicy and sour and

full of all the stuff this is just subtle and well 
balanced but not under season I mean the saltiness

is perfect where it is for the touch of sweetness 
to balance a little bit of pepperiness from that

white pepper I mean this I've been eating this 
ever since I was a little kid and I still love

it every time I eat far too much of this because 
it's just so hard to stop it's really fun mmm I

hope you give this a try I am always so happy to 
be able to share like a recipe from my family so

you can share it with your families and when you 
make it I would love to see a photo of it come

send it to me on Facebook Twitter or Instagram 
and if you haven't subscribed to the show make

sure you do so you don't miss a recipe like this 
and click the little bell icon as well so you get

a notification when I post a new video if you love 
the show and you want to support us check out our

patreon link in the description below and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious time
